revision.text: Possibly: Essays upon several moral subjects. In two parts. Part I. Upon pride. Upon cloaths. Upon duelling. Upon general kindness. Upon the office of a chaplain. Upon the weakness of human reason. Part II. Of fame. Of musick. Of the value of life. Of the spleen. Of eagerness of desire. Of friendship. Of popularity. A thought. Of the entertainment of books. Of confidence. Of envy. Of the aspect. Against despair. Of covetousness. Of liberty. Of old age. Of pleasure. By Jeremy Collier. (London : Printed for D. Brown, without Temple-Bar, R. Sare, near Gray's-Inn-Gate. B. and S. Tooke, at the Middle-Temple Gate, G. Strahan, at the Royal Exchange, W. Mears, and F. Clay, both without Temple-Bar, 1722.) http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2406411~S1
